meanings.definition: Regard or treat as of little value or account.
meanings.sent1: She disprizes her old toys now that she has new ones.
meanings.sent2: He always disprizes the effort his teammates put into the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat disprizes the toy mouse, preferring a real one instead.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism disprizes the hard work of others.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's harsh words disprize the students' creativity.

meanings.sent1: They disprize the importance of teamwork in achieving success.
meanings.sent2: She tends to disprize her own abilities, not realizing how talented she is.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel disprizes the size of the acorn, not knowing it will grow into a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent4: His lack of confidence disprizes his potential for greatness.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring her skills will only disprize the value she brings to the team.

meanings.sent1: He disprizes the achievements of others to make himself feel superior.
meanings.sent2: She should not disprize the hard work that went into creating such a beautiful piece of art.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes may disprize certain groups, causing offense.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism only serves to disprize the efforts of those around him.
meanings.sent5: Using hurtful words to disprize someone is never acceptable.
